title: Australia v India: men’s first one-day international – live
summary: The summer cricket season kicks off with the first ODI at Optus Stadium in Perth. Rob Smyth will provide live updates throughout the match. Fans can expect engaging coverage as the action unfolds.

title: Nottingham Forest latest and buildup to Liverpool v Manchester United – matchday live
summary: Engage with our writers for pre-game news and discussions. Get insights and build anticipation for today’s major matches. Don't miss the chance to immerse yourself in sports chatter!

title: Developers encroach on 2,000-year-old Devon wetland citing ‘blockages’ to Labour’s housing plans
summary: Wolborough Fen in Newton Abbot is under protection as groundwork begins for the construction of 1,200 new homes. Planning conditions mandate safeguarding the fen during this development phase. The project aims to balance housing needs with environmental preservation.

title: French theme park firm won UK government support despite far-right ties
summary: A Tory trade minister has pledged to support the establishment of a £600 million Puy du Fou site in Oxfordshire, according to leaked emails. The planned site is expected to boost tourism and create jobs in the area. The commitment indicates the government's focus on promoting investment in local attractions.

title: ‘I don’t really have sex to music, it’s a bit Tom Cruise’: Miles Kane’s honest playlist
summary: The frontman of the Last Shadow Puppets and renowned singer reflects on his musical journey, recalling his early days of buying No Limit at Woolworths. He discusses the emotional impact of certain songs from his past. Ultimately, he reveals the specific track that has the power to move him to tears.
